security_audit.summary: This skill contains only markdown documentation files with TypeScript code examples. No executable code, network calls, file system operations, or credential access patterns were detected. The content is purely educational reference material for Payload CMS development.

content.user_title: Build Next.js CMS applications with Payload
content.value_statement: Developers struggle to implement complex CMS features like access control, hooks, and database adapters correctly. This skill provides production-ready patterns for collections, fields, authentication, and API integrations.
actual_capabilities: Collection configuration with authentication, uploads, drafts, and versioning
Field types including relationships, arrays, blocks, geolocation, and virtual fields
Access control patterns for row-level security, RBAC, and multi-tenant applications
Hook patterns for data validation, side effects, and transaction management
Database adapter setup for MongoDB, PostgreSQL, and SQLite
Plugin development with TypeScript patterns and package structure
limitations: Requires existing Payload CMS project setup
Documentation-only skill without code execution capabilities
Does not include Payload Admin UI component development
GraphQL schema customization patterns are limited

output_examples.input: How do I create a posts collection with draft/publish workflow?
output: Configure the collection with versions and drafts enabled
The _status field is automatically added with draft/published states
Use draft: true parameter in create/update operations to save drafts
Access control can filter public users to only see published content
Scheduled publishing is available with schedulePublish option

best_practices: Always pass the req parameter in hook operations to maintain transaction atomicity
Set overrideAccess to false when passing a user parameter to enforce their permissions
Use context flags to prevent infinite loops when hooks trigger the same operation
anti_patterns: Passing user parameter without overrideAccess: false bypasses all access control
Omitting req in nested hook operations breaks database transaction atomicity
Creating hooks that trigger operations without context guards causes infinite loops

faq.question: Which databases does Payload CMS support?
faq.answer: Payload supports MongoDB, PostgreSQL, SQLite, Vercel Postgres, and Cloudflare D1 through official database adapters.

faq.question: What is the maximum number of collections I can create?
faq.answer: There is no hard limit on collections. Payload scales based on your database capacity and infrastructure.

faq.question: Can I use Payload with existing Next.js projects?
faq.answer: Yes. Payload 3.x installs directly in your Next.js app folder and shares the same server instance.

faq.question: Is my configuration data stored securely?
faq.answer: This skill only provides documentation. Your actual data security depends on your Payload configuration and hosting.

faq.question: Why are my access control rules not working?
faq.answer: Local API bypasses access control by default. Add overrideAccess: false when passing a user parameter.

faq.question: How does this compare to other CMS skills?
faq.answer: This skill focuses specifically on Payload CMS with comprehensive TypeScript patterns, hooks, and plugin development.
